QmTs7eLZTQh9Ufoe1YmPK84uXffb9bGLm4hozAtq.author: 0xE7e84204B7e180454e5C40d0e04D346214a83f85
QmTs7eLZTQh9Ufoe1YmPK84uXffb9bGLm4hozAtq.body:
This proposal is for the Crisis DAO Charter. Please review the charter and vote below. 

* Please vote **yes** to pass the charter. 
* If you want to revisit and go back to the drawing board, vote **no**.

You can visit the charter here: https://hackmd.io/PIH8UL0oQOeB10xyLvhpmw?edit

Charter is below:
----

## 1. About Crisis DAO

### Why it exists
    
CrisisDAO started when a group of technologists deliberately set out to recruit people from diverse backgrounds drawn by a common interest to explore the use of bleeding-edge technologies in the blockchain. Through tinkering, peer learning, and mentoring, we investigate new types of organizational decision-making to decipher what incentives may look like for an equitable organization.

Our thesis is that by building an investment DAO based on a frictionless, open, self-governing, cross-border agreement at scale and speed, we can create more sustainable and equitable participation and control and be more financially profitable than traditional companies.
    
### Mission
    
CrisisDAO is dedicated to creating open, self-governing, financially successful, blockchain-driven, cross-border agreement at scale and speed.
    
### Vision
    
To make CrisisDAO a new model for organizing human endeavors incorruptible, immutable, and equitable.

### Defining Success
    
If the CrisisDAO is successful, we will prove our protocols and systems work by having outsized financial returns with minimal harm on the earth or any living creature; and by increasing participation of our members and by others replicating our documented learnings.
    
A successful DAO is one that makes progress toward the future as described in the vision. This means five things:
    
1. Members are participating.
2. Proposals are created, a portion of which are successful.
3. Financial gains are realised. 
4. Lessons are learned, laws (code) are written or amended.
5. The process from 2 to 4 is documented so as to increase both participation of members and the learning of how DAO’s work.


---

## 2. Members Privileges and Obligations

Like a co-operative, members have the privilege to enjoy rewards, and in return, they have shared responsibilities toward a common goal. The CrisisDAO requires high member participation to be successful; it is not for spectators, therefore we as members:

1. Participate in the discussion, creation, voting and documentation of proposals.
2. Make friction, tension and inefficiencies known to all DAO members, so that changes, improvements and learning can take place.
3. Monitor and record progress, for the creation of metrics to measure DAO health.

### Membership Requirements

* By contributing to the DAO, you agree to be governed by this Charter
* Agree with the Code of Ethics
* Comply with the Code of Conduct
* Participate in the official communications channels on a regular basis
* [Link to Membership Document](https://hackmd.io/WYOfX4VfTmqJidQZWkP5dQ)

### New Members

CrisisDAO is open to all. However, we are temporarily restricting membership until processes/software allows for safe scaling of DAO. For details on safety, see [security team doc](https://hackmd.io/4_FDfBnPQbqGI7IuoZoEbw).

### Code of Conduct and Ethics

See annex [Code of Conduct draft](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jsH5YjkvkZW2LSoakjivk4wzPupAW7R0WsWjrR8laT0/edit?usp=sharing).
See annex [Code of Ethics](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GpEgORanfwwvrG8x4L6EYLmJ8nQ0RzJXtSh9uQW10Dk/edit?usp=sharing).

### Resolving Conflicts

Conflicts and disagreements are normal and part of any human endeavor. As a brand new organization, CrisisDAO doesn’t have all the answers yet. Members are expected to apply our values in creating and modifying the instruments for conflict resolution.
See annexure [Resolving conflict](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LFPuEd7asvzpCUc-LnWBdgeztRcokaesylEDmxOWn5Q/edit#heading=h.vorb1hmx6g5h).

### Taxes

Taxes are a Member’s own responsibility. Nothing the DAO or the members provide constitutes legal advice.


---

## 3. DAO Operations and Governance

DAOs are decentralized organizations. The CrisisDAO builds on shared interests managed through open and secure software that will help in the DAO’s governance. As we experiment with its day to day operations, we should always consider:

1. Is our operation following the long-term vision of CrisisDAO?
2. If the solution is repeatable and should be coded into software.

### Operating Agreement

The DAO is currently using the [Operating Agreement from May 27, 2021](https://hackmd.io/8kB9cHYXQIyOZj-VFcIR6g). Any changes to the Operating Agreement must be proposed and passed.

### Proposals

* All Proposals will conform to the default time periods of:
    * 2 days to vote
    * and quorum thresholds unless classified as a different type of Proposal.
* The Quorum threshold is defined by the minimum number of tokens that have voted in the proposal. 
    * The default quorum threshold is 30% of governance tokens in circulation. E.g. If we have 1000 total tokens in circulation, then we’ll need 300 tokens to reach the quorum threshold.
    * The DAO may propose different types of proposals that require a higher or lower threshold.
    * The DAO may change the default quorum threshold.
* A proposal may be re-proposed one time, subject to substantive differences in environment, market or circumstance.

### Delegation

The DAO allows members to explicitly delegate their votes to another member and remove the delegation at any time for any reason.

### Security

Funds, assets and data must be secured by the DAO security team. Details at [https://hackmd.io/4_FDfBnPQbqGI7IuoZoEbw](https://hackmd.io/4_FDfBnPQbqGI7IuoZoEbw)

## 4. Building the DAO Future

CRISIS DAO intends to eventually open membership to the public. During the pre-public phase we are measuring health based on a set of parameters that are flexible to accommodate learning and incentive-based to encourage participation and propel development and growth. Health measurements will surely change as learning accelerates and membership expands. We cannot anticipate all problems, but the hope is that gaps in procedure will be filled through amendments (proposals).

## DAO Health

Since the thesis of CrisisDAO is that our hive-mind is superior to just one ape brain, our goal is to align the DAO members to a shared set of objectives and encourage participation in the activities to achieve key results. The KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) are measurements we use to evaluate how the DAO is performing over time. The baseline KPIs include financials, member engagement, and proposals. The measurements will answer questions such as, how is the investment portfolio performing, what percentage of proposals are contributing to deal flow, and how many members are actively participating in voting. The indicators will be measured real-time, monthly or seasonally and will be accessible by all members. 
[Examples of the KPIs can be found here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1k1SonPuLyGwhzCTsgwvzcSsP68PeexjVzlYIkK-lHWk/edit#).

### Knowledge Sharing

To accelerate the world’s transition to equitable and just governance, we must document our stories and share them with the world. All of our documentations are [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/) by default. Members are encouraged to share our stories via social media and conferences.

### Epochs

Epochs are a defined season of DAO operations. Epoch 1 is from now until 12/31/2021. For example: If by the end of 2021, we have lost money, we can sell and tax harvest our losses. If we have gains, we can propose taking the gains on 1/1 or continuing the DAO. 

The DAO members will vote on the renewal of the DAO for one or more new Epochs before the end of each Epoch.
choices: No, back to the drawing board
QmTs7eLZTQh9Ufoe1YmPK84uXffb9bGLm4hozAtq.title: Crisis DAO Charter

QmXWT8nZbKfTcczxQJg3GEizbV1R9JcaUjHNWGAp.author: 0x961Aa96FebeE5465149a0787B03bFa14D8e9033F
QmXWT8nZbKfTcczxQJg3GEizbV1R9JcaUjHNWGAp.body:
Create a Gnosis multisig wallet to hold some subset of funds with a lower barrier to spending, so that we can capitalize on more urgent opportunities.

## Actions

1. Create a separate multisig wallet with 2 of N signatures required. N is the number of addresses in the relevant committees:
   **Scouting committee and Security committee members are included.**
3. Transfer a subset of CrisisDAO funds to the FOMOFund multisig:
   **Start with 5 ETH.** (Reups will be done through additional proposals.)

## Process

Two people agree that some opportunity is FOMO-worthy, then one of the following scenarios takes place:

1. Execute a multisig purchase directly from the FOMOFund.
2. One person buys it with their own money and gets reimbursed from the FOMOFund.
3. Funds are sent to a designated purchaser who makes the buy and transfers the assets to the CrisisDAO.

No snapshot voting is required to execute a FOMO purchase. An informal seconding (+1 or 👍) from a relevant committee member on Discord is sufficient.
QmXWT8nZbKfTcczxQJg3GEizbV1R9JcaUjHNWGAp.title: Create FOMOFund Multisig

QmY2Sbw56NCaTmKxHDJ3XS3uhUWTsEPargLz9b2X.author: 0x961Aa96FebeE5465149a0787B03bFa14D8e9033F
QmY2Sbw56NCaTmKxHDJ3XS3uhUWTsEPargLz9b2X.body:
## Background
There is a lot of volume in our DAO's discords right now, and it's difficult to keep track of action items.

## Proposal

Create a channel where only action items for the DAO members are posted, such as proposals to vote on. Replies and additional commentary is discouraged in this channel.
QmY2Sbw56NCaTmKxHDJ3XS3uhUWTsEPargLz9b2X.title: Create an action item announcement channel

QmdUPrWSqsasC3YNijH8HyLj4jvxJqqr6Lx1zvd3.author: 0xE7e84204B7e180454e5C40d0e04D346214a83f85
QmdUPrWSqsasC3YNijH8HyLj4jvxJqqr6Lx1zvd3.body:
We have a lot of ideas around the **CrisisDao**, what it should be, and how it should spend the treasury. There are a lot of questions and some good answers. Luckily, we have teams, and an effort to define the **CrisisDao** via a charter. 

**I propose that we don’t make any funds withdraws from the treasury until we have a charter that has passed by proposal.**

---

A charter will help us define what we want to the **CrisisDao** to be. It will also define how we wan tot use funds and hopefully make future proposals much easier and much cleaner. 

We have talked about a lot of ideas and potential paths. Let’s codify them, design the charter and then be able to act fast and accurately based on what we want the **CrisisDao** to do.
QmdUPrWSqsasC3YNijH8HyLj4jvxJqqr6Lx1zvd3.title: No funds draw until charter is complete

Qme95CsUyqy8c1N614Hqxko1VhoUpT94kNv2vmnp.author: 0x4558e88C5a972244c995AE4DD95a84fc790355f9
